availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton Calbertson (Mason County, Kentucky, hotel keeper, livery stable keeper, and councilman)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, hotel keeper, livery stable keeper, and councilman. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret M. K. Byrne Calbertson in Mason County, Kentucky, on August 2, 1837. Father of Levi P. Calbertson and Julius Calbertson. Hotel keeper in Mason County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Livery stable keeper in Mason County in 1860. Member of the Maysville Board of Council in Mason County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 35B-36A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 689.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, X County, Maysville, p. 335.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 2, p. 416A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mason County Marriages, Film #000281842.
"Milton Culbertson (1808-1874)," Find A Grave, Memorial #159673557, accessed January 31, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/159673557.
